Issues.Title: test(compiler-cli): Add test for checkTypeOfDomReferences = false
Issues.Body:
Add test for when `checkTypeOfDomReferences = false` to ensure that we
do not regress in behavior at any point. The desired behavior for this
case is that the `TemplateTypeChecker` will honor the user's
configuration and not produce symbols for the dom reference.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(compiler-cli): Add test for checkTypeOfDomReferences = false" (#39539)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): TemplateTypeChecker with checkTypeOfAttributes=false should still work
Issues.Body:
When the compiler option `checkTypeOfAttributes` is `false`, we should
still be able to produce type information from the
`TemplateTypeChecker`. The current behavior ignores all attributes that
map to directive inputs. This commit includes those attribute bindings
in the TCB but adds the "ignore for diagnostics" marker so they do not
produce errors. This way, consumers of the TTC (the Language Service)
can still get valid information about these attributes even when the
user has configured the compiler to not produce diagnostics/errors for them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): TemplateTypeChecker with checkTypeOfAttributes=false should still work" (#39537)

Issues.Title: perf(core): do not recurse into modules that have already been registered
Issues.Body:
When registering an NgModule based on its id, all transitively imported
NgModules are also registered. This commit introduces a visited set to
avoid traversing into NgModules that are reachable from multiple import
paths multiple times.

Fixes #39487
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(core): do not recurse into modules that have already been registered" (#39514)

Issues.Title: The keyvalue pipe does not work correctly with types. (Since v11-next.4)
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/common` ([/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/common/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts)) ### Is this a regression? The pipe from Angular version [11.0.0-next.3](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/11.0.0-next.3/packages/common/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts) works. But [11.0.0-next.4](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/11.0.0-next.4/packages/common/src/pipes/keyvalue_pipe.ts) does **not** work. I included the source code to my repository with another pipe name `mykeyvalue` and checked both versions on the latest Angular version. ### Description The `keyvalue` pipe does not work correctly with types. Since `11.0.0-next.4`. Changes: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/97866339-0ecc1180-1d0c-11eb-8953-a966a0adf595.png) ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction **Screenshots** ![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/97168146-3e1cd480-1788-11eb-929d-ea4b82aa7f9a.gif) (Gif Animation. Wait for the first frame in `app.component.html`) **Additional context** [**Download** Demo Project](https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/files/5438507/keyvalue-pipe-test.zip) **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Use the `keyvalue` pipe on a property with a custom type. See my source code blocks / graphics or download the demo (see below). 2. See that all properties of `value` are marked as error. The pipe does not pass the type correctly. 3. Build it. It works. But the error in editor persists. It seems to be related to the ng extension. 4. Try restart of VS Code. Nothing helped. **Source Code** app.component.html ```html
  • {{ entry.value.text }}
``` menu-items.model.ts ```ts export interface MenuItem { text: string; } export interface Menu { [key: string]: MenuItem; } ``` Other (Snippets): ```ts // app.component.ts import { MenuService } from './menu-items/menu-items.service'; export class AppComponent { constructor(public menuService: MenuService) {} } // menu-items.service.ts import { Menu, MenuItem } from './menu-items.model'; public menu: Menu = {}; // See model (above). ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

Identifier 'text' is not defined. 'V' does not contain such a member. (ng)
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.0-rc.0
Node: 10.22.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.0.0-rc.0    
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.0-rc.0

@schematics/angular             11.0.0-rc.0
@schematics/update              0.1100.0-rc.0
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.3
VS Code: ```text Version: 1.50.1 (user setup) Commit: d2e414d9e4239a252d1ab117bd7067f125afd80a Date: 2020-10-13T15:06:15.712Z Electron: 9.2.1 Chrome: 83.0.4103.122 Node.js: 12.14.1 V8: 8.3.110.13-electron.0 OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19041 ``` **Anything else relevant?** Also see: https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/946

[Angular 9 and ngx-BS 6.1.0](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-bootstrap-vjan8b?file=app%2Fapp.module.ts)

Issues.Title: Self-closing component tags (<my-comp/> instead of <my-comp></my-comp>)?
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package

This feature request is for `@angular/compiler`? Unsure.

### Description

The issue title pretty much covers it but here is another example:

```HTML
<super-duper-long-component-name [prop]="someVar" />
<!-- instead of -->
<super-duper-long-component-name [prop]="someVar"></super-duper-long-component-name>
```

There is an existing issue for this, #673, but it was closed due to inactivity.

That issue got half-rejected (it was not resolved) on the basis of the HTML spec, which does not allow self-closing tags. That makes a total of **zero** sense to me. The HTML template language is already far beyond what vanilla HTML offers, and that is the entire point of using a framework like Angular. Many other major frameworks (React/Vue/Svelte to name a few) already support self-closing component tags.

I understand that Angular templates were being parsed in the browser before, but why should ease-of-life syntax sugar be banned when using AOT compilation? Sure, some people still use JIT-compiled Angular, but then again, some people still use Internet Explorer in 2020. If they want to suffer so be it but why refuse to add excellent features for the rest of us? There are plenty of antifeatures out there but I personally think self-closing tags are pretty intuitive and improve the code quality significantly; from the looks of #673 it seems like a lot of other people agree.

Please reconsider self-closing component tags.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Continue to sigh as I write needlessly verbose code and write checks for two different nullish types.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Self-closing component tags (<my-comp/> instead of <my-comp></my-comp>)?" (#39525)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): avoid duplicate diagnostics about unknown pipes
Issues.Body:
TCB generation occasionally transforms binding expressions twice, which can
result in a `BindingPipe` operation being `resolve()`'d multiple times. When
the pipe does not exist, this caused multiple OOB diagnostics to be recorded
about the missing pipe.

This commit fixes the problem by making the OOB recorder track which pipe
expressions have had diagnostics produced already, and only producing them
once per expression.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): avoid duplicate diagnostics about unknown pipes" (#39517)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): produce binding access when checkTypeOfOutput…
Issues.Body:
…Events is false

When `checkTypeOfOutputEvents` is `false`, we still need to produce the access
to the `EventEmitter` so the Language Service can still get the
type information about the field. That is, in a template `<div
(output)="handle($event)"`, we still want to be able to grab information
when the cursor is inside the "output" parens. The flag is intended only
to affect whether the compiler produces diagnostics for the inferred
type of the `$event`.

TODO: similar refactor for `checkTypeOfDomEvents` after #39312 is submitted
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): produce binding access when checkTypeOfOutput…" (#39515)

Issues.Title: fix(http): queue jsonp <script> tag onLoad event handler in microtask
Issues.Body:
Fixes #39496

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: #39496

Before this change, when trying to load a JSONP script that calls the JSONP callback inside a setTimeout function, it will fail in Internet Explorer 11 and EdgeHTML.

## What is the new behavior?

This commit changes the event handler on the script tag to be queued with setTimeout. This ensures that the aforementioned browsers will first evaluate the loaded script calling the JSONP callback and only then run the load handler which does the tear down of the callback function and script tag.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(http): queue jsonp <script> tag onLoad event handler in microtask" (#39512)

Issues.Title: Angular 11: Material Icons are not rendered after build and they're displayed as text
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/material @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/cli 10.2.0, @angular/material 10.2.6 ### Description After running `ng build --prod` and running the app from `dist` folder, the Material Icons are not rendered and they're displayed as text only. It looks like the issue is in the generated `dist/index.html` file: ```html App Title ``` In previous version, the `dist/index.html` file was generated as follows: ```html App Title ``` ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction I successfully reproduced the issue in my repo [https://github.com/luixaviles/web-speech-angular](https://github.com/luixaviles/web-speech-angular). Just follow the next steps: ``` git clone -b 11.0.0-rc.1 https://github.com/luixaviles/web-speech-angular.git npm install ng build --prod http-server dist/web-speech-angular ``` Then verify in your browser and take a look into `dist/index.html` vs `index.html` file. ## 🔥 Exception or Error
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.0-rc.1
Node: 12.16.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.0-rc.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: Validate extracted i18n messages for duplicates
Issues.Body:
This change will analyze the extract i18n messages for duplicates and issue warnings for each case.  This provides the same default behavior as the standalone message extractor contained within `@angular/localize`.  Configurability of the behavior of a detected duplicate (ignore, warn, error) will be added in a future feature.

Closes #19207

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): mark rxjs add imports as having side effects
Issues.Body: This change prevents the build optimizer from removing the operator add imports from the rxjs package (for example, `import 'rxjs/add/operator/filter';`).  The entire rxjs package is currently marked as side effect free from within the rxjs `package.json` but the files in the add directory intentionally contain side effects.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): mark rxjs add imports as having side effects" (#19260)

Issues.Title: Angular 11 doesn´t work serving application with a Material prebuilt theme
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/material ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 10.x and 11.0-next-6 ### Description This error occurs only when using webpack 5, it works correctly using webpack 4. In the construction phase everything works correctly, but when running the application's serve, if we have a material style sheet loaded it fails to start the application. Within a normal Angular 11 app with webpack 5 if you load an external stylesheet inside you angular.json the app builts correctly but it doesn´t work running ng serve. angular.json 

"styles": [
   "./node_modules/@angular/material/prebuilt-themes/pink-bluegrey.css",
   "src/styles.scss"
],
But if you delete the external stylesheet, it build and run with no errors. angular.json 

"styles": [
   "src/styles.scss"
],
## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction i´ve created a repo with the reproduction of the issue https://github.com/Coolpix/test-angular11 As i´m using webpack5 with module federation i must use yarn, so to run the application follow this steps: 

yarn
yarn build
yarn serve
Delete the external stylesheet inside angular.json 

"styles": [
   "src/styles.scss"
],
Runs yarn serve once again and it works. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 



(node:28104) [DEP_WEBPACK_CHUNK_MODULES_ITERABLE] DeprecationWarning: Chunk.modulesIterable: Use new ChunkGraph API
(node:28104) [DEP_WEBPACK_CHUNK_ENTRY_MODULE] DeprecationWarning: Chunk.entryModule: Use new ChunkGraph API
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:**

OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: feat(material): grid system missing in `@angular/material`
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Hi,
Angular material is listed for example in [this article](https://medium.com/@dharmendraoist/19-best-angular-ui-frameworks-to-use-for-faster-development-in-2020-b50e8e8c5072) as the most used and top ui lib. for angular. I personally like it 👍 

If i compare `@angular/material` to `ngx-bootstrap` or `ng-prime` or even `salesforce`. I see a missing part 'the grid system'.
bootstrap: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/
prime: https://www.primefaces.org/primeng-flexgrid/
salesforce/lightning: http://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/utilities/grid/

material.io website describes a [grid system here](https://material.io/design/layout/responsive-layout-grid.html).

The request:
 If it's `@angular/flex-layout` then it should be linked in the documentation of the github repo. as official grid-system.
Or **I think personally that `@angular/material` should add it's own with css classes and not directives => like other libs do.**

side notes:
- https://blog.logrocket.com/css-grid-or-css-frameworks/
Css grid is not used everywhere. A lot incorp. are still using a grid system from css-frameworks.

- I see some teams in companies **including bootstrap only for the grid system** on top of `@angular/material`.

Thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(material): grid system missing in `@angular/material`" (#20950)

Issues.Title: feat(datepicker): stand-alone/inline calendar component usage should be documented
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

While it's possible to use the calendar component without the date input, its usage is not documented. Documentation explaining how to use it in single and date range selection modes should be introduced so that people wouldn't have to look into project sources to figure out how it's supposed to be used.
Even single selection mode is pretty straight-forward and there are comments explaining what the inputs and outputs do, it's not trivial to figure out how to use it in date range selection mode.
[Calendar date range selection example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dfqwce?file=src/app/date-range-picker-overview-example.html)

#### Use Case

- Custom date range picker with predefined date range types and other features:
![custom date range picker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/768105/97707936-4d698e00-1ab8-11eb-8c5e-8b098e5e94ca.PNG)
- Use it in a dashboard to show current date
- Appointment booking application where it would be used to show available appointment dates
- Some event scheduling application
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(datepicker): stand-alone/inline calendar component usage should be documented" (#20931)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): range input emitters not picked up by language service
Issues.Body:
The `dateChange` and `dateInput` outputs are inherited through a mixin which seems to prevent the language service from picking them up. These changes add extra hints to the component metadata.

Fixes #20932.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): range input emitters not picked up by language service" (#20937)

Issues.Title: fix(material/input): preserve native placeholder on non-legacy appearances
Issues.Body:
The `legacy` form field appearance has a feature where it promotes the input placeholder to the form field label which introduces a problem where screen readers will read out the placeholder twice. Some time ago we added logic to clear the placeholder, but it seems to be a bit too aggressive since it also clears the placeholder for other appearances.

These changes scope the workaround only to the case when a placeholder would be promoted to a label.

Fixes #20903.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/input): preserve native placeholder on non-legacy appearances" (#20936)

Issues.Title: feat(Expansion Panel Header): Provide a way to disable keydown event
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

By default, the mat-expansion-panel-header adds a keydown event, breaking some potential functionalities.

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/f7d7502f9eba5293c98841a0e7063bd84589a340/src/material/expansion/expansion-panel-header.ts#L63

We should be able to disable this feature.

#### Use Case

Adding a keydown event is preventing the possibility to add editable field inside the expansion header as the user is not able to enter spaces or add a new line.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(Expansion Panel Header): Provide a way to disable keydown event" (#20934)

Issues.Title: bug(datepicker): "matStartDate" and "matEndDate" input directive "dateInput" and "dateChange" outputs are not recognized by Angular language service
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. If you try to use `dateInput` or `dateChange` outputs with `matStartDate` or `matEndDate` directives in IDE which uses Angular language service for Angular template validation, you'll see that those outputs are marked as invalid:

![date input error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/768105/97709296-62dfb780-1aba-11eb-8309-66b7550e0d53.png)
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

IDE should not complain about `dateInput` and `dateChange` outputs since they are valid.

#### Actual Behavior

IDE displays error indicating that those outputs are invalid even they are valid.

#### Additional information

This does not happen with `matDatepicker` directive. When used with `matDatepicker`, those outputs are recognized by the Angular language service.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10.2.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(datepicker): "matStartDate" and "matEndDate" input directive "dateInput" and "dateChange" outputs are not recognized by Angular language service" (#20932)
